Detailed Description

Base class for test_base template.

This class keeps track of the test mode flags and of the error count. It is responsible for formatting the test failure messages. It also takes care of the dynamic initialisation of test suites from the command line.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef std::vector<std::string> fructose::test_root::suite
 

Type of test suite

A suite is just a list of test case names.

Member Function Documentation

void fructose::test_root::decrease_error_count (   )  [inline]
 

Decrease error count. It is possible to have tests involving exception handling that cause std::uncaught_exception to be true, even if no exception escapes. These routines can call this method to fix the error count.

test_root::suite fructose::test_root::do_get_suite (  const suite &  available_tests,
int  argc,
char *  argv[]
)  [inline, protected]
 

Populate test suite.

Populate suite from command line, taking into account the test case available_tests. Display usage info and exit if -h flag set.

Parameters:
available_tests - The list of available tests
argc - The argument counter parameter passed to main
argv - The argument array passed to main
Returns:
The list of test cases selected by the user

int fructose::test_root::exception_handler (   )  [inline, static]
 

Generic execption handler for use in test drivers

Rethrow current exception, print what string for standard exceptions and "unknown exception" for any other exception. Return EXIT_FAILURE for use as exit code by the main function of the test driver.

Returns:
EXIT_FAILURE

Increase error count by one.

int fructose::test_root::return_status (   )  const [inline]
 

Accessor for test return status

Compute the return status for use by test driver main.

Returns:
Return status: EXIT_SUCCESS if error count is 0, EXIT_FAILURE otherise

void fructose::test_root::reverse_mode (  bool  flag  )  [inline]
 

Setter for reverse mode flag

Revert the meaning of condition for convenient testing of the test framework.

Parameters:
flag - the desired setting of the reverse mode

bool fructose::test_root::reverse_mode (   )  const [inline]
 

Accessor for reverse mode flag

Return true if reverse mode is set. Nornally this will never be true, it is provided for testing the framework. It is used by the -reverse command line option for such testing, to reverse the sense of test assertions.

Returns:
The current setting of the reverse mode flag

void fructose::test_root::set_test_name (  const std::string &  test_name  )  [inline]
 

Set the name of the current test.

void fructose::test_root::setup (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Setup initial conditions for each test.

void fructose::test_root::stop_on_failure (  bool  flag  )  [inline]
 

Setter for stop-on-failure mode flag

Switch on/off stop-on-failure mode. By default this flag is off, Turning it on causes the test harness to consider the first assertion failure to be fatal.

Parameters:
flag - the desired setting of the stop-on-failure mode

bool fructose::test_root::stop_on_failure (   )  const [inline]
 

Accessor for stop-on-failure mode flag

Return true if stop-on-failure mode is set. By default this value is false, i.e. when a test fails the harness continues to run the other tests, producing a count of all the failed tests at the end.

Returns:
The current setting of the stop-on-failure mode flag

void fructose::test_root::teardown (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Undo any work that needs undoing from setup (for each test).

void fructose::test_root::test_assert (  bool  condition,
const std::string &  test_case_name,
const char *  msg,
const char *  filename,
int  line_number
)  [inline]
 

Tests the specified condition which must be true for the test to pass. If the condition is false then test case name, the filename, and line number are reported and the error count is increased. Note that because this sets an error status the method cannot be static.

Parameters:
condition - the condition to be checked by the test
test_case_name - the name of the enclosing test case
msg - the message to be printed on failure
filename - the name of the file containing the test
line_number - the location of the test assertion in the test source file

void fructose::test_root::test_assert_double_eq (  double  lhs,
double  rhs,
double  relative_tolerance,
double  absolute_tolerance,
const std::string &  test_case_name,
const char *  msg1,
const char *  msg2,
const char *  filename,
int  line_number
) 
 

Tests that two doubles are equal. The floating point comparison is made with specified values for relative and absolute tolerance. If this condition is false then test case name, the filename, and line number are reported and the error count is increased. Note that because this sets an error status the method cannot be static.

Parameters:
lhs - the value on the left hand side of the expression (lhs == rhs)
rhs - the value on the right hand side of the expression (lhs == rhs)
test_case_name - the name of the enclosing test case
msg - the message to be printed on failure
filename - the name of the file containing the test
line_number - the location of the test assertion in the test source file

const std::string &  test_case_name,
const char *  msg1,
const char *  msg2,
const char *  filename,
int  line_number
) 
 

Tests that two doubles are equal. The floating point comparison is made using default values for relative and absolute tolerance. If this condition is false then test case name, the filename, and line number are reported and the error count is increased. Note that because this sets an error status the method cannot be static.

Parameters:
lhs - the value on the left hand side of the expression (lhs == rhs)

test_case_name - the name of the enclosing test case
msg - the message to be printed on failure

line_number - the location of the test assertion in the test source file

std::string fructose::test_root::underline (  const std::string &  title,
char  uline = '='
)  [inline, static]
 

Convenience function for underlying a title

Create a string of a specifyable underline character for underlying a given title. This is used when the verbose flag is on, to show in a pretty way which test is being run.

Parameters:
title - The title to be underlined
uline - The character to be used for underlining
Returns:
The underlining string
